Reviews.Content: This little Camera is best in its league, well reviewed, full HD, amazing pictures. I needed a small portable camera next to my SLR and this was my choice. Recommended to anyone who is looking for stunning picture and HD video recording with amazing quality.Service was prompt, and arrived on time.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I received my camera and I just love it.  I takes very nice pictures even in low light.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fine for non-photographers, but not worth the price if you aren't a beginner
Reviews.Author: Rodney E. Fisk "Making your life better since...
Reviews.Content: It looked like such a great product in the store. The photos looked so crisp. It boots instantly. The movies look great. It has a great lens. Then, I imported the photos into Lightroom and displayed them on my 24" monitor. What a letdown! I shoot Nikon dSLR and I am a lover of the brand. I have several thousand dollars invested, so my purchase was made as much out of brand loyalty as any other factor. The guy at the store and I were comparing zooming and movies and such... I was sure this was it. I noticed there wasn't a M (for manual) on the dial. I thought: " it'll be someplace in the menus." All of Canon's compacts have it. Kodak has it. It's on there." WRONG.They spit out all these numbers about resolution, pixel count, and that rear screen makes them look so good! Yeah, only when they're that small. If you only intend to make 4x6 prints with the photos from this camera, then I'm sure it's fine. I don't need to make billboards, but geez! At least I should be able to see it on my 24" screen.I'm not sure GPS was any kind of deal breaker, but three other comparably priced and featured cameras have it!The flash! Don't get me started. It pops up in this crazy spot and then you can't put it back down! True. It only goes down when the camera turns off. Who was in charge of that feature? Every online review has mentioned this problem. BTW, it is a really good flash unit.The rubber thumb grip on back is a little inadequate. Since I only get to use one hand (The flash and lens take away the ability to use the other) I need to be able to hold onto the camera. The JPG quality is horrible. I'm surprised that Nikon would do so badly with it. They have good compression on the consumer dSLR's. I know they're more expensive, but JPG compression doesn't come from their R&D;, it is available anywhere. You can forget about cropping any of these photos; they're too badly compressed. There are too many artifacts.The unit seems to randomly have trouble focusing on objects. There seems to be no rhyme or reason. Sometimes it just won't lock focus and it doesn't matter if it's close (even with macro mode turned on) or far, light or dark.Given all these negatives, there are a few good things about it. The movies look good on my 42" television. That they got right. It records in 1080p. The anti shake is good for me and the colors are vibrant and attractive. I did not make use of the stereo microphones, so I have no comment on that matter. The unit powers up quickly and when it feels like focusing it gives quick focus. The rapid fire 10-shot burst works wonderfully. It's great for sporting events or anything moving. The lens is clear, fast, and has a great breadth of range.All-in-all the Nikon Coolpix S8200 is overpriced for the amount of camera that you get. If you just want to shoot snapshots and print 4x6's or upload to social media sites, then get a less expensive camera with the same feature set. Olympus and Canon have some wonderful offerings, some of which are waterproof. If you are a photographer, whether advanced amateur or professional, then move on down the line. This camera just doesn't cut it if you indent to crop or enlarge. There's no GPS, which may not be a must-have, but better units in this price range have it.I'm sorry Nikon, you just dropped the ball on this one.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give a lower rating. This camera worked fine for a few months, but the camera broke out of nowhere! I've charged the camera up and it will not turn on. I am not the only one with this issue, and unfortunately I failed to notice. Boo to this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I Could Ever Buy
Reviews.Author: OuchyPerson
Reviews.Content: I already had one of this camera but my husband wanted it as well. Its video recording capabilities are amazing for such a low price. At concerts it picks up the bands and instruments and not the screaming crowd (doesn't matter where you stand). The zoom on the camera works amazing, and photos no matter what come out clear (image when taken may look blurry but the photo looks just great.) We often get asked when out and about using the camera where we got it and its model number because it dose so well.  Can't weight till my next concert when I will now have 2 of these cameras to capture twice as much.

Reviews.Title: A great point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: unbidden16
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera...Pros:-Nice zoom-range-Compact design-Operator-friendly-Great quality photos/clear imaging-Descent film for price-range of cameraCons:-Battery life-Awkward placement of flash-Slow-to-take shots when utilizing specific SCENE optionsNow, to explain. This camera, for its price-range, is loaded with many great picture options. I have had several digital cameras before I stumbled across the `Coolpix' brand in Nikon. None of them have had the kind of quality I've been able to gain from the Coolpix line. In specific, I have owned the S3300 and the S6100 before the S8200. There were no issues with the previous cameras...I just outgrew the features and moved onto `bigger and better'.The pros far outweigh the cons with this camera. It's not to be expected to get `professional-grade-photos' from this digital as it is NOT a `professional' camera, but that does not mean that you will be foregoing quality here.  I am not upset by any slight distortion/clutter in the movie option due to the fact that I wanted a camera...not a camcorder. The video quality is above acceptable for my uses of it. Also, it's normal for most digital cameras to have a shorter battery life especially when extra features are added and utilized (such as a GPS option which is NOT in this camera model). The flash, which some are bothered by, is in an awkward position for most hands, but I have had no problems with it as I have smaller hands and hold my cameras differently. I am slightly disappointed with the slower-to-take pictures if I am in certain modes, but the overall picture quality is worth any additional, slight wait. The wait is never present on Auto Mode. As stated, the photo quality is magnificent for this priced camera and for a `novice' or `active' photographer.I would suggest this camera to many, if not all, of my friends seeking cameras.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great, Amazon fails though.
Reviews.Author: alundra
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift with 2 day shipping. The order was fine and showed up on time, and what a great camera it was! Awesome pictures, love the HD video, but the order was incomplete. As it was a gift purchase, the card I had filled out to be sent with the package was not included, and neither was the SD card that was suppose to come as well. The card was small, and I had planned to buy a larger one eventually anyways, so it's not a huge deal. Still though, come on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased...at least for a while...
Reviews.Author: EverSinging
Reviews.Content: Of all the point and shoot cameras I've owned this is by far my favorite.  Save for the bizarre flash placement (which I catch on my finger frequently)I don't have any complaints.  I simply love the picture quality.  The shutter speed is quick, which is important for busy moms!  It's still very new to me.  I'll update this review when I'm better acquainted with the camera.Edit 10/2013I'm sad to see that I'm experiencing the same lens error other users have mentioned in these reviews.  This camera cost too much, in my opinion, at the time of purchase for it to break in a year and a half.  It's a shame because I really liked the camera and the pictures it took, but it would cost more than the camera is worth to repair the lens error.  Since this seems to be an issue with other users, I won't buy the same model again.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera when it works
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: Pros:I am not a camera expert, but I generally do my research and it was a nice, quick camera.Cons:The flash location is extremely annoying. This camera slowly died over a few weeks. The lens will power on, but the LCD is black. Over a few weeks the color on the LCD showed incorrect pictures like half purple and half normal picture. Eventually it stopped working after only owning the camera for approximately 2 months and on the first day of a vacation. Nikon support was poor at best. They scrutinized the camera to find any blemish and labeled it as an "impact" spot so that it wasn't covered under warranty. I can guarantee that there was no impact that caused the failure. So, anyway, I now have a $300 brick camera. I personally will not be using Nikon again. For you Nikon fans, I would at least avoid this model.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8200 Camera
Reviews.Author: RAYMOND STRAND "Ray"
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with my new Nikon Coolpix S8200 Camera.  I picked this camera over the Canon SX230HS because of the display screen being higher resolution and not the wide 16:9 format.  Also the flash was rated better on the Nikon.  I did not want the GPS feature on the canon either (drains batteries).  I wanted a camera with a lot more zoom than my old camera - which was 6X, and yet I did not want to mess with tripods to take a far away picture.  I also wanted a smaller sized - easy to use camera.  This camera does the job very well.  I have had quite good results using the full 14X zoom outside on a sunny day - hand held.  I do not take video's, so I cannot report on that.

Reviews.Title: best lcd screen among all piont&shot;
Reviews.Author: DL
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these, one for myself, one for my brother.Have nothing but praise, this is a solid camera, create beautiful picture as an P&S.;It has the brightest lcd screen among point&*shot cameras ( I currently own Canon S95, Leica D-Lux,flagship Sony Cybershot, Canon Rebel T3i DSLR, Sony NEX 7).Brought this camera along with DSLR on my trip,the high pexel and against light dial make them taking very good pictures.Price is another plus. Great pocket cameraMy favorite two P&S; is this camera (I think better deal than Canon S95)

Reviews.Title: Pleased with results
Reviews.Author: Digital Princess
Reviews.Content: Got this camera after much reassarch. I'm just an amateur but the pics are looking good to me. What scares me is how fragile these cameras seem . I wish i could put a lens cap or something on there. Guess all the PS cameras are like that. Video is surprisingly good too.

Reviews.Title: Superb point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Ty
Reviews.Content: The camera has a great size, weight, and feel. The large screen makes menu navigation and photo framing easy. I'm using a 4GB class 10 SD card, and photo write time is less than a second. The flash charges quickly and the camera is ready for the next shot with a second after taking one. The lens is large and does well with low light. 1080p video and stereo sound is stunning.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Patrick R. Mckula
Reviews.Content: high quality pics and 1080 vids.  I upgraded from a 4 year old sony camera and this one blows it out of the water.  Got it for the wife for Christmas and she loves it.  Stuck in a 16 GB card and she has 30 minutes of 1080 video power.  Price at amazon was by far the best

Reviews.Title: HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED OVER THE YEARS!!
Reviews.Author: Woob
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago and it disappoints me more everyday.MAKE SURE YOU READ ALL REVIEWS ON THESE PRODUCTS.I went camping last summer and made sure the camera was fully charged before we left..even brought the car charger just in case.When I arrived and tried turning on the camera to take pictures, it wouldn't turn on.Hadn't dropped it, hadn't turned it on since we left the house, nothing to have messed the camera up in anyway.I was so disappointed that my trip would not be recorded, but only in my mind.We tried multiple times of turning it on, taking the battery out, charging it more in the car, whatever we could think of and nothing.When we arrived home, my boyfriend got online and looked up the camera.Apparently I wasn't the only disappointed customer in this product.There were multiple websites with comments from previous owners of this camera stating that the camera will just shut down on you.You have to take the memory card out and charge it a certain way to get it to even hold a charge after a while even thought it will tell you it is fully charged.NOW IN THE RECENT MONTHS OF TRYING TO USE THIS PRODUCT FOR LITTLE PROJECTS, I can't even seem to get the camera to want to TAKE A PICTURE.Now that I know that I have to take multiple steps to charge this product, and IT IS ON, it just doesn't want to snap the photo.I have read many angry comments on this product.There have been many comments sent to Nikon about it and frankly they just do not care to recall or even give a response back to anyone of us about this concern.I have sent multiple emails to Nikon myself and nothing has been returned back.Personally I think the company does not care enough about their customers to even give an acknowledgement to their unhappy customers.Since I spent over $300 on this product a few years ago I have purchased a nice Cannon Rebel and it has been amazing for me.I do a lot of portraits and outdoor shooting and it has worked wonders for me.If I have any questions about the features on this product, Cannon happily replies in a mannerly time..and I am assuming that IF (because I have not) I have any problems with this product they will be happy to help in any way possible.PLEASE BE CAREFUL IN THE PRODUCTS YOU PURCHASE BEFORE YOU DO..JUST BECAUSE THE PRICE IS GOOD, DOESN'T MEAN THE PRODUCT IS.

Reviews.Title: The Pics and and videos are great but a big flaw!
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have had this camera for about a year now. The picture quality is superb and the videos are nice. The other positive is that it is made to conserve battery life and it works well. The one big flaw that made it drop two stars is the flash. The flash is hidden and when it is needed it pops out of the top of the camera where I put my finger to hold the camera. Almost every first picture I take has to be retaken because the pop out flash hits my finger and always messes up the first photo. The camera is not that big so I need to hold it some where. It is a very poor place to position the flash. Every time you turn the camera off the flash goes back down into the camera ready to pop up again when it is reactivated. Its pretty aggravating. I wold say look for another camera that has a better positioned flash.  But if you think you could be ok with this aggravation the camera does take great photos.

Reviews.Title: Short life, unfortunately.
Reviews.Author: Anne E. Price
Reviews.Content: After extensive reviews research, I purchased what I thought would be the ideal camera for me. It worked well in the beginning, but after the one-year warranty (of course) it began to have issues. The menu button worked only occasionally. And finally the lens would no longer focus or retract, citing a "lens error". I'm out over $200 for a camera I bought last year. This is unacceptable. No matter how much research I do, at least next time I'll know to buy the extended warranty. Very unhappy. :-(

Reviews.Title: This camera takes beautiful photos and nice video.
Reviews.Author: Geoff  L. Clarke
Reviews.Content: The camera takes beautiful photos and has intuitive controls. The single button for video is very convenient. One issue is that the flash pops up in low light. You cannot put it down unless you power down. The body is a little large, but reasonable. Overall it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good calera
Reviews.Author: FSM "FSM"
Reviews.Content: Everything simple to use and very good quality pictures.If only...the flash is in a awkward position, where you would put you left index finger, and when it pops out, doesn't return until you turn the camera off...

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Tammy Griffin
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera.  Very easy to operate even for someone who is not very tech savvy; and it takes great pictures!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera.
Reviews.Author: Casey Cottrill
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics & 1080P movies! I did quit working on me while on vaca. The shutter got stuck open & ran the battery clear out. Charged it up, seems fine now.

Reviews.Title: really good camera
Reviews.Author: Yvonne Tejada
Reviews.Content: The camera has a really good resolution. It is even better than others more sophisticated nikon's camera. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Leon W. Couch III
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and has more settings than one needs (that is something I like).  The menu system is okay.The picture quality is excellent.  The sound is okay.  With movies, there is no image stabilization, so things can sometimes look shaky. The nighttime vision one doesn't seem to give measurably better images and takes a long time to process.  The zoom feature is pretty good for a camera that is this portable and in an affordable price range.The image screen on the back works well, as it's pretty large compared to the size of the camera.  The screen is not touch screen, which I'm glad about.The battery life is pretty good.  One can make between 2 and 3 30-minute movies with one charge.The case comes with a plastic coating, which starts to flake off.  So, mine doesn't look pristine, as I'd like it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: melissa
Reviews.Content: I had a cannon that I loved for 10 years. When it finally died, my son told me to try the Nikon Coolpix, He has the S8100. When I looked at my options I couldn't believe how great they all were. As good as a professional but portable.I love this camera. The shots are so clear and it's easy to use. Except I am still getting used to the flash that pops up right where I normally put my finger to hold the camera. I will get used to it.There are so many features, I will have to learn them one at a time.Nikon is the way to go, especially if you can find a good sale.Even my fiance, whose a professional photographer, loves this camera and is just as amazed as I am.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera! MUST have!
Reviews.Author: nat89
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Our daughter is turning a year old and I'm tired of all the crummy picts my old camera takes so we decided to look for a new one before her bday party and I am so glad we decided on this one! I was worried we wouldn't get it in time because it had such a broad arrival date but we got it in plenty of time, only a week after we ordered it. I'm not very technologically smart so I was a little skeptical about my ability to run something with so many features but I've found it's quite simple for something so advanced. The features it's equipped with are awesome! There's a 'pet portrait' that automatically takes a pict when you point it at an animal-every other digital, phone, and disposable camera I've used to take picts of my dog leaves his a eyes a white glare and this one takes a very detailed and clear pict with no glare at all! There is a 'smile' feature that automatically takes a pict when you aim it a person and they smile which is really nice bcuz if you have kids you know every smile counts and we want to catch it-the flash it super quick and I love that there is NO DELAY. It flashes once and takes the pict as it flashes so she doesn't have time to react and close her eyes :) I can't tell you how many picts we have of her with her eyes closed or squinted! It has an auto 'red eye fix' that saves me a lot of time when I go through and print off picts. It has a feature that you can set to take picts in black and white or red or gray tint which is cool if I'm taking a pict and her outfit clashes with someone else's outfit (I've never been able to do that, you can always make the pict black and white when you print it off, but this will save you some time). This camera has an excellent zoom that doesn't take away from the quality or clearity of the pict no matter how far you zoom. It comes with a rechargeable lithium battery which is a huge money saver for us bcuz we take a ton of picts and used to go through a lot of AA batteries, which aren't cheap. You can also take videos and the 'auto steady' feature is really impressive. It's not a setting that you have to turn on, it just automatically does it and it makes a huge difference. Out of curiosity I took a pict of some decorations with this one and our old camera and the difference in the two is unbelivable! This camera takes spectacular picts that are crisp, clear, bright and overall really great in quality. My only regret it that we didn't order this camera sooner. I'm a very conservative spender and this, is MONEY WELL SPENT!

Reviews.Title: EXACTLY what I wanted!!
Reviews.Author: GAIL FLEISSNER
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.This is my second one after I dropped and broke the first one.This dealer offered the best price of anywhere else I checked.PLEASURE to do business with them!!!!

Reviews.Title: I love Nikon... BUT
Reviews.Author: Bartdog
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've bought this exact camera.  The problems we had were so ( I thought ) quirky that surely the next one would be OK.  Both of the cameras I bought did the same thing.  After about a month, the battery dies after a couple of pictures.  Then after another week, the camera won't power on at all.  Returned to Amazon, thankfully had a couple of days left.This is crazy because I have a D60 which I have loved for 4 years.  My other daughter has a smaller coolipix that works like a champ for the last 5 years.  I don't know if we'll try another Nikon or not.  When it did work, this camera performed better than expected.  My daughter is very creative for a self taughter point/shoot photographer and she loved it.[edit 5/22/2013] Just after writing the original review, I went back to Best Buy and they took the camera back for repair (I was barely in time).  So far, it's been working just fine and we're happy with it.  Added a star back to the review.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: btshoe
Reviews.Content: Others recommended this camera for its portability and quality photos.  That's why I bought it and it worked out just as they described.  I have a Nikon D80 for family photos and local use, but the Coolpix S8200 is perfect for trips and activities where I don't want to worry about security.  Great detail and response time.  The 5-star rating is based on compact design, ease of use, portability, and photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Possibly the best P&S; Ever!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I've owned several film and digital SLRs over the years; very few point and shoots.  I bought my first S8200 as a replacement for an older Sony P&S; several years ago.  My wife ended up using it so much that I've just bought myself a replacement of the same model.  I considered several other cameras and tested quite a few, including the Canon S95 and S100, and Coolpix S9200.  I found that I didn't need any of the 'upgrade' features of the newer models and also felt that the performance of the S9200 was below that of the S8200.  Plus, saving the extra money allows me to more easily purchase more SLR lenses for my other cameras.I cannot really compare it with the Canon G series or Nikon P series, as they are so different.  But all in all, the S8200 is possibly the best simple P&S; I've ever used.  Very quick AF and excellent metering.  Macro mode works Very well.  Would buy it again and again.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: DENNIS HAWKINS
Reviews.Content: My wife I bought a Pentax Optio for xmas two years ago. It was nice but it didn't take very good  pictures and I really didn't like the idea that I had to carry 2 double a batteries with me. So I began looking at the Nikon coolplix. I ended up buying a coolplix S8100. The S8100 was Great, it's easy to use and takes great pictures. It comes with  Recharger.This year I wanted to buy my wife a S8100 because also didn't like useing her old Pentex camera. Most of her pictures would not come out that good.I ended up buying the new S8200 for myself and giving her my old S8100. I love my new S8200 and my wife now takes much Better pictures with my old S8100. A win win for me!

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: retiringtoNH
Reviews.Content: the pictures are sharp and i like using this camera with all it's settings. i do however need to always remember where the flash pops up from. It's placement (top left hand corner) is where most would automatically hold a small camera and the shot is usually wasted if you forget.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Hunter "designerphyl"
Reviews.Content: We really like this camera.  It is small and takes great pictures.  Going on a cruise in the spring and can't wait to use it.

Reviews.Title: An awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Ambrish
Reviews.Content: This is the best point and shoot camera at a very reasonable price. It has great ability to click photographs under low light.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Pliny82
Reviews.Content: Full featured and easy to use, this camera is great for everyday photos. We bought it as we're about to be first time parents and couldn't handle the iPhone camera doing everything anymore.

Reviews.Title: Nice shooting
Reviews.Author: S. S. Richards "S, Steve Richards"
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this camera. It is easy to use and gives great photos. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with some idiosyncracies
Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money.  It takes sharp pictures, even in dim lighting.  The LCD screen is very sharp and easy to see, even when it's bright outside.  The menu is fairly intuitive and there are a lot of settings, probably will never use them all but nice to have.  I mostly use this for family pics, so there is no serious photography but I really like the ability to take pictures when it's dark and dim; the pictures so far have good detail.  I haven't had much chance to use the flash yet.But, it's the flash that is not so great; it pops up right where you would put your finger on the left side of the camera to hold it.  I think this is just poor design.  So far, I've tried to avoid using the flash because of this problem, good thing the camera is able to take good pictures w/o it.Other than this, I think the camera is fine, a little thick but that's because of the lens, I suppose.  All in all, I would recommend this camera due to the pictures it takes and the ease of use.  But the flash location may bother you, so be aware.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, poor design
Reviews.Author: Gordon Cavalero
Reviews.Content: Have used Nikon professionally for 35 years. Replaced a Canon point and shoot with the S8200.  Controls are relatively easy to use. Don't like the flash system. Often thought I turned it off only to have it pop up. Had to turn camera off re set the flash to off, missing photo opportunity. Haven't printed any photos yet. They look good in iPhoto so far. Would probably purchase again.

Reviews.Title: good point and shoot with some flaws
Reviews.Author: MIKE G "MDG"
Reviews.Content: This little gem has some problems that, in my opinion, take it out of the 5 star ratings!  To say that the batteries are less than efficient is an understatement.  I have gotten as few as 25 pix on a fully charged battery.  Today, I was taking some pix when the message came on that the battery was about to die.  I took a backup out of my bag, it had been in there off the charger for about a week.  When I turned the camera back on, and took 5 photos, I got the message again and the machine went dead.  Hardley what one expects!!!!I have taken some great photos with this but fear that if it is so stingy with the power, I will give up!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: little BIG shot
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade from my Nikon S500. After researching different camera brands I ended up still liking Nikon best. I decided on the S8200 for its 14x zoom lens, which still allowed the camera to be compact enough to be carried around in my purse. The picture quality is outstanding. Images come out super sharp and skin tones look perfect. The zoom is great. It's nearly impossible to take a bad picture. With all of it's fun features and special effects options, this camera makes taking pictures so much fun. Did I mention just how fast the 8200 is? It snaps the picture almost instantaneously. Definately the fastest point and shoot camera I have ever held in my hands. I would have given the camera 5 stars, but I had to go with just 4 stars for 2 reasons: 1. The location of the pop-up flash is where you're left hand would be holding the camera, so you have to be really careful that your fingers aren't blocking the flash. Number 2. Unlike my old S500, The battery for the S8200 charges in the camera. I do not like this. Would much rather just put the battery itself into a charger and plug it in. I ended up ordering a spare battery and a seperate charger. I was pretty disappointed that I had to spend the extra money on that.

Reviews.Title: Great photos...bulky camera.
Reviews.Author: Lennie Smalls
Reviews.Content: This is the first Nikon point and shoot camera i have ever purchased, I am a cannon girl. However, this is works fairly well given the price. I do have some general complaints relating to the DESIGN of the camera. tHE 14X zoom makes the lens on the camera rather long and gives the front of the camera a very bulky look (overall the camera is very bulky in all aspects and has some weight to it). Also, as many people have noted, the location of the flash in not remotely practical and become annoying after a while, therefore, one must always be aware of where their left hand is located when taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Audio Recording Issue and Beeping
Reviews.Author: Daniella
Reviews.Content: Overall, the camera was very good. I have a couple of issues with it though.When recording, it records the closest thing that makes noise.  For example, I recorded a performance in Disney World and the performance sounded like background noise instead of playing it back clearly as the main audio.  (I was in the front row.)  The clearer audio was when the speakers closest to me made noise or if someone near me said something.  I was disappointed when I replayed my videos that I recorded due to the audio, but the actual video quality was good.No one has mentioned this before in a review, so I thought it should be said for future buyers to consider.The second issue was the noise the camera makes when you are doing tasks.  It does a slight beeping noise that I have not been able to turn off.  It is a slight annoyance when taking a lot of pictures because it makes a noise for every action you do.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 8200S
Reviews.Author: SJR
Reviews.Content: This camera is well worth its cost.  Takes great pictures and easy to use. I am very please with this camera and would recommend it for anyone wanting a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Katie Cab
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. My only complaint is the flash that pops up. If you are unaware of the flash you might ruin your picture by putting your finger where the flash is. Other than that the camera takes fantastic pictures.

Reviews.Title: I like it- you just need to get used to the controls
Reviews.Author: MiniBookCritic
Reviews.Content: First, I'm going to warn you, I'm a very new "photographer." I consider it a hobby, and by no means know much about cameras. I had to get a new camera because the screen on my other one got cracked, and I wanted a better camera rather than replacing the screen. I also just got the S8200 a few days ago, and this is first thoughts review.I'm sure most of the complaints are about the quality of the photos- that's just because you might have to mess around with the settings first. My first Coolpix was an S220, so all the controls were a bit different. I had to look through the reference manual, which is on a CD to figure some of them out. There are settings where you can take sequences of photos, and I had to figure out how to make that stop.Once you learn the controls a little better, it's a LOT easier to use. My other complaint is the flash. Once it comes up, you have to turn the entire thing back off to get it to go back down.It's a little bigger than most cameras, but that is because of the large lens to get the larger zoom.Overall, as the basic "photographer" my pictures came out very nice. After I figured out how to use the settings, it was a lot more fun to use the camera.I wish the flash could be pushed back down, but that's the only real issue, everything else you have to (and can) figure out with the manual. (You know, like most things.)Update: I LOVE THIS CAMERA! We went to Washington, D.C and my camera took the best pictures! My entire family now has a coolpix of some sort.Another slight issue is, sometimes if you are close to something, but you want to zoom in more, the camera won't focus. You have to mess around a bit, like backing up and then zooming to make it work. That could be an issue if you are trying to get a shot of something that is moving a lot.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs Up
Reviews.Author: Gardening Fool "kindsoul"
Reviews.Content: I did the agonizing and the hours of online research. Bought and returned three other PSs. I rejected those on image quality, and that;s despite the very high ratings one of them, the Canon sh60x, gets very high scores everywhere.This was staring me in the face the whole time. I tried it out at Best Buy and bought it. I bought it because the macro seemed excellent (on the lcd) and the LCD itself is gorgeous. The resolution is very crisp and the colors vibrant.It is priced low and doesn't have some things I would have liked--manual abilities for focus and exposure, mainly--but I can see already that this will not leave my side for a long time.

Reviews.Title: A customer that couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: ilovetobike "lovetobike"
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera for my daughters trip abroad, so I started my search online. I read many reviews about different cameras. Found the Nikon S8100 and saw it to be the favorite choice for a whole lot of people. I compared the specs with a bunch of other cameras and this one had the overall best. I didn't buy it for about a week, but when I did, the S8200 had just come out and was recommended that I purchase that one. I did and the camera is fantastic! My daughter was abroad for two weeks and took over 1,000 pictures. She won't stop telling me how wonderful the camera is and how she loves the zoom. Buy this camera! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Chief Chuckie
Reviews.Content: Preparing for the vacation of my lifetime, I wanted a camera that would do it all and do it easily. The Coolpix S8200 fills the bill. Movies? Can do with 1 button! Stills? Up to 14x zoom for closeups (digitally doubled) and the old wait-for-focus -fuggedaboudit! If you have the time, wait as you press the shutter release, but this camera is quick! One review I read complained about the flash popping up in the top left corner -they were right! Everyone I know holds the camera in their left hand with fingers on top so they can press the button with their right hand. Then, suddenly, you feel this pressure under your fingers. Oh no, here comes the flash! Nikon should have thought that one through better. One other cool thing about this unit, it takes panorama shots of 180 or 360 degrees! And stitches them together beautifully. I haven't had one printed yet, but the presentation on screen (camera or TV) is impressive. What's to think about -Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: Meredith
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this camera and I wish I had gotten it sooner. It takes great shots and has a lot of great and useful functions.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S8200
Reviews.Author: rsinl
Reviews.Content: Camera takes very good pics.  Some focusing problems "locking on" (in the auto mode) occassionaly.  Seems the close photos are when it has most focusing issues for me.  I mean 12"-16" close or so.  Otherwise the camera is great.  The pop up flash is tricky but once you know where it pops up, you should not have a problem.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8200
Reviews.Author: D. Davis
Reviews.Content: After researching the Coolpixs I bought the S8200.  I was looking for a small pocket size Nikon with a high telephoto lens - This one has a 14x Wow ! and it is not bad.  I also own a S630 Nikon with a 7x, but this is a lot better. It also has an awesome 1080 video with stereo mics. I used it at a concert and it had great sound and the picture was great too (even zoomed to the max optical). The pixs were so-so without the flash indoors  ( a bit blurry) - with the flash under 10 feet were very good, outdoor great! The 16.1 MP is good for this size camera.  The S9200 was not as good as the S8200 in my opinion.  Now there is a NEW S9300, but I cannot comment on that one, as have not tried it yet. Paid just over $200.00 - and take as good pictures as my $800 DSLR Sony alpha 350, but not as fast on moving objects. If you are looking for a purse or pocket size camera with high end features then get the S8200, but if you like hauling a heavy DSLR on vacation then take your camera bag. Very happy with this camera by Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8200 Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter H. Dirnbach
Reviews.Content: Did not had the opportunity to use this camera extensively. Took a number of pictures and am very pleased with the results. The resolution seems to be excellent. Took some pictures outdoors during daytime. The results were very sharp pictures using both normal and close- ups. Also took some shots at night and again had very pleasing results. Using this camera one has to be careful how to hold it. Usually the left hand is positioned right where the flash comes up, so one has to get used to hold the camera somehow different as not to block the flash from being extended. Haven't experimented with taking movies as yet. Amazon did not disappoint me in purchasing this unit. The price was right and the delivery came on time as promised.

Reviews.Title: Decent daytime pictures, not so great low light performance
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jad"
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to use this camera for night time or indoor shots. All of the shots I tried to take in a club or indoors are too blurry or, if the flash is used, too bright with terrible color. On the other hand, it does take great video. I've also used the Fujifilm Finepix F505 EXR, which I find much better than this camera, and the Canon S95 which just blows this camera out of the water and is not that much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Definitely good
Reviews.Author: dayana josefina rondon gutierrez
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I think it's and excellent product. Just what I wanted. The supllier was very responsible with your submission.

Reviews.Title: More Megapixels Than Needed
Reviews.Author: betsy bishop
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful point and shoot digital camera, that is ideal for travel. I have taken some wonderful photos with this little guy, and accompanying software is fairly easy to use. I prefer to use it on 8 MP's, as the photos are still very sharp and they do not take up as much memory as 16 MP's. I purchased this because it has a lot of the features found on my larger Nikon, which had become so bulky to carry on trips. I do miss my other lenses, though.

Reviews.Title: One of the best point-and-shoots I've had
Reviews.Author: S Amazon
Reviews.Content: One of the best point-and-shoots I've had. Awesome picture quality, really easy to use. Though, it is just over a year old, and I've worn it out.

Reviews.Title: Has some problems
Reviews.Author: GetEd
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera when I first received it. However, within about 4 mos, I noticed some kind of powdery looking effect on the lower corner of the lcd screen when it is off. It didn't seem to affect the photos, and I was too busy to deal with warranty at that time. The powdery effect has spread a bit now, and I have no idea what it is. At first, I was impressed with being able to take a large number of photos on one charge. However, by one year, I had to buy new batteries (specific for this camera) which also did not hold much of a charge after a very short while, about 2-3 uses. I might get 20-30 pics and then it's done. I find it hard to believe it is the 3 separate batteries at fault, and I have become very careful not to use any unnecessary features, such as reviewing photos, or constant focusing. It often refuses to focus, especially when in close-up, or zoom. Today, the camera takes very poorly colored, grainy pictures without the flash, whereas it was great to begin with. I cannot take any pictures of the moon, no matter what kind of weather, which is 50% what I bought it for. All it ever shows is a blurry mass with a heavy halo, no matter how clear it looks to me, no matter the zoom, the setting used, etc. The camera takes FOREVER to save a night-scape photo as well.

Reviews.Title: Love my Nikon
Reviews.Author: Jessica G
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about two years ago, I still love it just as much as the day I bought it. It takes wonderful pictures that look good whether on your camera screen or your computer screen.Pros1. Very good picture quality2. pretty good zoom3. good photo effectscons1. lens cover sticks sometimes2. I wish you could turn on the camera while charging

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality
Reviews.Author: CARLOS ALFREDO CASTELLAN
Reviews.Content: A camera that surprises you in the first time, robust, and easy to handle. Its features are impressive, as the Zoom which is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: No surprises
Reviews.Author: Janice A. Knudson
Reviews.Content: Although this was a used camera, it arrived exactly as described in working order.  I had broken my previous camera which was the same model and was happy to replace it for less than full price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Bennett
Reviews.Content: I've always liked the Nikon for his sharp pictures, this camera has everything you will ever need.  It's compact and easy to use. It's big screen allows you to capture your pictures and every detail that you want to compose within your pictures.

Reviews.Title: Cheap for price
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn Anne Collom
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures! But it took about two weeks to get to me and that's just unacceptable. Also when I zoom, it makes this strange noise that is definitely audible. I need to go to Best Buy or something to see if all of these cameras do that or just this one. And it said that I was buying a new camera but the box was seriously banged up and had obviously been opened a bunch of times. I don't know if I'll be keeping this yet. This camera just seems and feels so cheap for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Two of the three have issues
Reviews.Author: Olympic Associates Company
Reviews.Content: Not happy with this purchase,  We have gotten these many times from Best Buy and have had really good luck.  These are used for investigations outside in our business.  These three seem like refurbished ones.  Not new.  One has lense issues and the other doesn't hold a charge.  I have given the 3rd one out to replace one and we shall see how it works out.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Diana Beaudoin
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for me as I use it in my business as a RE appraiser.  My first one bit the dust after several drops to concrete.  I needed to hang on to it better, such as using the strap.  Love this camera for the wide angel and zooming capabilities.  Very clear photos.  Forget your phone camera this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Lairet "Ringo"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for 2 years now and it is amazing how reliable it is. The quality of the pictures and videos is amazing, given its low price. I dop not doubt a bit to recommend this camera to amateur photographers!!!

Reviews.Title: Flash located in a bad spot
Reviews.Author: Ki Michele
Reviews.Content: I am really satisfied except for the fact that the flash jumps up on the left side where your hand is holding the camera.No other camera I've used, professional or otherwise, ever had this feature placed in such an inconvient spot.

Reviews.Title: S8200 Nikon Coolpix camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Weddle Fetter
Reviews.Content: No memory card came with this camera. Unable to take a picture until I purchased one. A really great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Product Nikon
Reviews.Author: gilbert a coerper
Reviews.Content: I gave 5 stars because it does everything I want it to do I take 100's of pics and it goes with me where ever I go, not to mention it fits in my pocket.This is my second Nikon same model, my other ended up in a river quite by mistake.

Reviews.Title: This has been a great little point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Techspec
Reviews.Content: This has been a great little point and shoot camera. I was hesitant about the battery since it is a custom format, but the battery usually lasts for hundreds of shots and with the addition of a backup battery I have never lost a shot due to the bettery quitting at the exact wrong time, as they always seem to.The camera does have a number of shortcomings as you might expect with such a low price (some lens induced distortions and rough pixelation/noise in low light in particular) but it is definitely worth the it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful prints and video, just watch for the flash.
Reviews.Author: Persnickity Buyer "Persnickity Buyer"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good.  Unfortunately the location of the flash is not at all convenient.  As a matter of fact, the flash popping up can cause many to drop the camera because you just don't realize the placement.  I could have easily given this a five star rating if the flash was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8200
Reviews.Author: John M. Leonard
Reviews.Content: This camera is a handy size to put in your pocket; it takes good pictures and is easy to use.  It has a lot of capability that I have never used.  After I bought one for myself and used it for awhile, I bought another one for my wife.

Reviews.Title: More ups than downs
Reviews.Author: SWY11389
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera quite a while and so far so good. It takes great pictures and the zoom is pretty amazing. The extra setttings that are programmed in work quite well. The only thing I don't like is the auto setting doesn't seem to function that well. It has a nice weight to it which makes it easier to keep it stable when taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Carol Bruneel
Reviews.Content: I dropped my other camera just like this one. I like this one so much I looked for another one just like it and found it here.  I was very happy to get it was mailed in a short time.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald W. Seams
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use.  We have not been bothered as some are by the flash popping up under your finger.  Once you are aware of it, you kinda work around it.  We like the fast charge time between pictures, no longer do we have to wait to click another picture.  Size is wonderful, fits into your pocket or purse easily.  It would nice if it came with a usb to micro-usb cable.

Reviews.Title: Better pictures than your phone
Reviews.Author: LB State Alum
Reviews.Content: Purchased 2 cameras for youth to use in a photography class. Took good pictures for a point and shoot, battery life is adequate. Flash is a little harsh but similar to point and shoots. Takes great picks when flash not needed.

Reviews.Title: Low quality
Reviews.Author: Mili
Reviews.Content: i hated!Stopped working within a monthWarranty was bad as well.Low quality product bad costumer service from manufacturer

Reviews.Title: just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Phyllis
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and is easy and very portable.  It's my replacement for the same camera that I lost on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing purchase
Reviews.Author: Pamela Oliverio
Reviews.Content: The description didn't quite match the camera itself, poor quality , not easy to navigate  through the various settings. Disappointing purchase.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend!
Reviews.Author: Rachael
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's a bit bulky but it is worth it because the photos and videos are GREAT quality. I have dropped it and it's pretty sturdy. I've owned it for a long time and it is still just as great as when I first used it.

Reviews.Title: good for dark places bands playing ect.
Reviews.Author: Michael Bomback
Reviews.Content: Good for darker rooms , have scene cell phones take better pics , and camera that cost somewhat more than this take great pics.This camera is like a muddy jeep not pretty but it works , auto focus is why i would not tell a friend to buy one.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Judy Ross
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it is small and easy to carry, takes great pictures that can be zoomed in on to get an even greater picture of some things, like insect faces for instance.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: snap snap...snap snap snap!
Reviews.Author: Darcy Conrad "bookworm"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my aunt last year, and she took it with her this summer on a vacation trip to Colombia. She loved it and found herself wanting to take a picture of everything, all the time, just snapping away. It was adorable to watch and the pictures came out great. She is not the most tech-savvy person, but it was super easy for her to make sense of the buttons and whatnot. She may not know EVERYTHING it is capable of yet, but she snaps away whenever she can.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Johnna Milby
Reviews.Content: This takes beautiful pictures and look as well if not better then pro pics we had done. It is easy to use and light weight. highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Bruce French
Reviews.Content: Takes much better pics than her last camera, better zoom and flash. Takes very good indoor photos. She really enjoys taking pics now.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, good deal, fast delivery
Reviews.Author: e gary schatz "fisherman"
Reviews.Content: Now my wife and I are using the same model camera - easy to interchange memory cards, etc.  It is a very good camera and I was delighted to see that it was in perfect shape.  No bruises of any kind.  Good show!

Reviews.Title: Perfect travel companion
Reviews.Author: William S.
Reviews.Content: Although this camera has been superseded by a newer model, this camera makes beautiful photos and videos. It is easy to use in auto modes, and has many scene modes for those who prefer to let the camera do the thinking. It feels solid in the hand, and it has easy to use controls. It has pretty good battery life, at least for me who seldom uses the flash and who takes 2-300 photos over a week's trip. Good deal for anyone who wants great photos at a great price.

Reviews.Title: just what i wanted!
Reviews.Author: Michael. G
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! Take amazing pictures! Took it to Canada and it really captured all the natural beauty.Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Only One Flaw
Reviews.Author: GD
Reviews.Content: For $178, without tax, this camera is a must have. I've had this camera for a few days now and it takes great pictures. The video quality is great as well!  However, one major flaw, that I can't help but hate the designer of the camera for is the flash location and functionality. Before purchasing the camera, I did extensive research in regards to functionality of the camera as well as user reviews. So I had an idea of what I was getting into with this camera. My main issue is the flash location. The flash "pops up" in an awkward position, and is "UNABLE" to be put back down unless the camera is turned off completely. Though when you do turn off the camera to put the flash down, it goes down automatically, no user intervention is necessary. It is just unnecessary to turn off the camera just to get rid of the pop up flash. Pushing it down when the camera is on, just pops it right back up. As stated from Nikon Article 50879 "There are no plans or service options at the present time to modify the camera so that the flash is lowered manually by pushing it down."Source: [...]The flash in itself is great, however, should not have to turn off the camera just to put the pop up flash back down.

Reviews.Title: One year later and still loving it. Better than the s9300!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn M M
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year now with absolutely no problems. I use it about once a week with a Class 10 SDHC Extreme card. At the time of purchase I compared it to the higher model, the 9300 and actually got consistently better shots with this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: A Lot of Camera for a Little Money
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Witty
Reviews.Content: Okay, the price is just under $200.00, and that's not a particularly small amount of money but, for the price, there really is a lot of camera in this camera. I was, and still am for that matter, impressed that there are actual, functional options for focusing and metering. Before film got too expensive and somewhat inconvenient to process I was shooting with a Nikon FM2 and absolutely loved that camera, and though comparing the S8200 to the FM2 is a case of "apples and oranges", it's nice to find that the camera offers some control over the metering and focus, as does the FM2, and as a result, produces absolutely beautiful images as did the FM2.My only gripe, and this is probably an issue with all rear displays on digital cameras, is that in bright sunlight the displayed image appears to disappear until you shade the display with your hand or turn away from your subject. The first time I saw this happen I thought I'd accidentally powered the camera off but no, in bright sunlight at the proper angle, (and lord only knows what that is), the display looks black, just like when the camera actually is powered off. Fortunately, the ability to take a picture with one hand while simultaneously shading the display with the other so you can still see what you're shooting is an option with the S8200.So, the camera is small, lightweight, loaded with nice features, and is very easy to use. Would that I could upload a sample picture with this review but, since I can't, you'll have to take my word for it about the picture quality and everything else. I will say that the pictures I have taken with this camera are nothing short of amazing. The colors are vibrant, the images are very sharp, and the metering options really do make a visible difference and come in very handy when shooting outdoors. A few of the pictures I have from a recent road trip are so clear, crisp, and sharp it almost looks like you could step right into the photo. My use of Photoshop with the images was minimal and consisted mainly of cropping the images to what I saw in my head at the time I composed and took the picture. No sharpening was needed and, other than a few early pictures when I was figuring the camera out, little if any color, contrast, or brightness adjustments were needed. Most of the pictures taken later in the trip required only cropping and nothing else.In short, this is a great little camera and I won't be going on any road trips without it.

Reviews.Title: Great Shots
Reviews.Author: Charlotte O'donnell "IrishGal"
Reviews.Content: Great shots, easy to use, quick focus between shots so I can catch a moment I might have missed.  Really like it so far.

Reviews.Title: A WINNER FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: nh biker
Reviews.Content: I use this all the time.  The quality of pictures is awesome and it is very easy to use.  Had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera

I find Nikon cameras easy to use, intuitive and weighted correctly for the hand.  I agree with others in that if you're not used to the flash it can take awhile to get used to - but I like the throwback design of the pop-up flash.  I also like the strength of the flash - as always, Nikon comes through.  Nice job!

Reviews.Title: Effective outdoor travel zoom
Reviews.Author: J. Dormont
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: utter lack of manual controls, some poor automatic choices, mediocre IQ, weak AF, and a lame flash design all amount to make this an over-priced, under-performing travel zoom. That said, under the right conditions (sunrise to sunset), this is a nifty little camera that in the right hands can take great photos and fool your friends at home into thinking you lugged the big guy out.If you like your nikon DSLR, but don't want to stash a camera bag when you go on vacation or are traveling on your next voyage and you thought "I bet Nikon has a great travel zoom" you're making the same mistake I did. It's extraordinarily frustrating not having any control over aperture and even trying to outsmart the camera by boosting ISO won't give you a satisfactorily high shutter speed in many occasions. So if you're looking for a pocketable version of your DSLR with nice focal range look elsewhere.But put it on auto (the modes are silly), and you can change WB, color sat, exp compensation, metering and AF mode to take a bit more control (slightly ironic I think). The video is easy, intuitive, and high quality and in the more than 1k shots I took with this on safari (didn't have the option of bringing my DSLR) I have many wonderful memories and many excellent photos. A 350mm equivalent focal distance will help a lot paired with relatively fast continuous shooting.Overall, not recommended for the DSLR amateur or enthusiast, but can be great for someone who just wants good quality pics on their travels.

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Miller
Reviews.Content: I bought this to upgrade from a digital camera I bought several years ago. I got it just in time for my visit with family on Thanksgiving. I am very pleased with the quality of the pictures it takes. I did read other reviews before purchasing. The location of the flash has not been an issue for me so far I just hold the camera in a way that my finger doesn't cover it. As far as not being able to push the flash down unless you turn the camera off, not an issue for me either. I have it in auto mode so if I need the flash for the first shot, I more than likely need it for the next shot. If I go from inside (low light) to outside (bright) I wouldn't leave the camera on anyways. I would turn it off to save the battery. So all in all I would recommend this camera for the quality photos as long as the flash doesn't seem like it would be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!

I would just say that sometimes video does not focus if there is no perfect light. Reviews.Title: Love my new camera.

Reviews.Content: I have only had it a month, but have taken several groups of pictures...Best one I had purchasedso far.

Reviews.Title: Not As Much Better than the S8100 as You'd Expect
Reviews.Author: Alexander C. Zorach "Alex Zorach"
Reviews.Content: My Nikon Coolpix S8100 broke--by no fault of the manufacturer, I dropped it multiple times, on hard surfaces.  Silly me (I'm amazed at how durable it was and how long it continued to work after being dropped, cracked open, and put back together).  I bought this as a replacement; it's a similar camera, and was cheaper, thanks to the advancement of technology.This is not the groundbreaking camera that the S8100 is.  When I bought the S8100, I tested it out alongside a bunch of other cameras from various manufacturers, and I felt that it was way ahead of other point-and-shoots in its price range.  It was a very balanced camera relative to its resolution; I found it took much better pictures than some cameras with a higher megapixel rating.This camera adds more zoom (10x->14x), MUCH better image stabilization, faster flash cycling, and that's about it.  The megapixel rating has jumped from 12 to 16, and you know what that means?  Absolutely nothing.  I think that, for once, Nikon has created an imbalanced camera, where the resolution of the sensor is not the limiting factor when taking photos.  I also don't like that the flash can't be mechanically popped down, once popped up; you need to turn off the camera to do this.  But I do find the flash cycling is faster, which I like.On the image stabilization...it's really, really good compared to the previous model, and I thought it was already good.  I am able to take photos at about 1/3rd the shutter speed that I was on the S8100, and have them still come out okay.  I am pretty wowed by this one advancement.  But in practice, it's not really as much of a gain as you'd think, because once you get below maybe about 1/30th of a second, you're going to see blur unless you are looking at a completely still target anyway.My remaining comments about this are pretty much the same as the S8100; if you want the whole thing, read my review of that camera.  Quick summary: great low-light performance, small size, easy to use, quick startup and flash cycling.  Downsides: ISO change requires going into the menu, writing images is slow even with a fast memory card, and STILL has overzealous noise correction.I'd buy it again, but, if I hadn't needed a quick replacement camera similar to my old one, I would have tested out other cameras more, because this one didn't really amaze me the way the S8100 did in its day.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: phoenix
Reviews.Content: this was a really good camera, i've been using it for about a year.  the pics are high quality, the videos are good, and theres lots of settings you can use for different situations... like landscape, sunset, night landscape, up close for flowers and bugs and leaves, ... you can set the camera on a flat surface and it will take pictures 10-15 seconds later BY ITSELF!  and also the battery is really good and it doesnt take very long to turn the camera on and off.  the only thing that i didnt like about it is sometimes the camera auto-adjusts lighting... sometimes i want to take a picture without the autoadjust lighting, but its a digital camera so idk if you can get around that.  but yea basically its a great camera. and the memory chip plugs right into the side of my macbook pro, so i dont have to worry about the obnoxious transfer wires that take like 1 hr to find but its the wrong one so you have to look for the other one... and then you forget which one is the actual wire... haha you all know what i mean
