Reviews.Title: Best camera on the market as of 1 Aug 2012
Reviews.Author: WoodPatternExpert
Reviews.Content: I did a LOT of research and this is the best camera for the price on the market at this time.  It zooms very well and will take very close photos and take great photos in bright light and great photos in dark light without the use of a tripod.  Oh and it fits in your pocket so you can actually bring it with you without a suitcase that is needed for any other camera with this type of zoom, photo quality etc.  Bottom line I recommend this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: G. Ramirez
Reviews.Content: I have owned a few digital cameras over the years, and this is by far the best one I've ever owned. I am amazed at the quality of the pictures it takes. It also takes 1080p HD video and comes with lots of other features. The only thing I'm not too fond of is the proprietary battery - it would have been nice if it used AA or even AAA batteries. Seems to work well, though. This is the first Nikon digital camera I've used, and I will only be buying Nikon in the future!

Reviews.Title: NIKON Coolpix S8200
Reviews.Author: T2
Reviews.Content: Although I've only just received the camera, I can say that it is capable of taking some pretty nice photos. 5 stars would be for a perfect product, and this camera is not even close to perfect. However, all in all, I do like it. The service from AMAZON.COM was very, very good.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: C. Gemon "jade"
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best little digital camera that I have ever owned.  I did a lot of research before finally settling on this product.  I have just returned from a three week European vacation where I took almost 1,600 photos. 99.9% of the photos are perfect.  The camera worked well in low light and at night and shot amazing videos as well.  I do agree with other reviewers that the flash is totally misplaced.  I'm not sure what the designers were thinking (or if they were thinking at all).  But the camera works so well and is such a powerful product that I would not take off a star for that mistake.  What I liked a lot was the ability to edit photos right after I shot them. I could crop them, adjust the lighting, etc with very little effort! I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Some Reveiwer Guy "D.C."
Reviews.Content: I won't go into all the features.  I just want to add that this camera broke on the second day of my vacation.  I didn't drop it or mishandle it.  I charged it before I left, took about 20 pictures, and then the battery died and would not recharge.  It was a brand new camera.  I got maybe 30 pictures out of it and then had to rely on my iphone as my camera for the next month of traveling through Europe.  Very disappointing.  And of course I wasn't able to return it within 30 days because I was traveling, so now I can't return it to Amazon and have to go through the manufacturer for a replacement....fantastic.  I'm also not going to get a refund on my memory card or camera case.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: J. L. Ryan
Reviews.Content: First everyone complains about the flash location. This camera takes great pictures in very low light so turn off the flash and it won't popup. Also the newer ones have a battery indicator that shows full,half and exhausted.Hardly ever get a bad picture.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: HeatherAndTheBoys
Reviews.Content: In August my husband and I are taking our boy to Disney world for the first time and I wanted to make sure I had a nice camera that also took great video! So I did a lot of research and decided to go with the Nikon 8200 (Which is my first Nikon) and I have to say I have not been disappointed! This camera rocks! And it takes great pictures every-time! Even on the 4th of July I got the best pictures of fireworks that I have ever gotten with a camera! Our vacation is coming up quickly and I am very pleased with this purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8200
Reviews.Author: Packer Fan
Reviews.Content: Much improved flash mechanism over previous version. Image stabilization works well. Zoom is excellent. Very happy with this purchase! Would recommend to someone I liked and valued as a friend!

Reviews.Title: The One Handed Camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Beal
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 4 months now.  I'm still amazed at the quality and the cool features packed into this sweet little camera.  I've shared some pictures in the view section.  They're the fireworks shots, which I took this past Independence day. This camera has a scene selection just for that.  Please take a look at my shots. ( Just a note about the fireworks feature:  Make sure you keep the camera still.  The shutter takes about 4 seconds to capture these shots.  One should use a tripod...or do what I did.  As I was sitting in my lawn chair, I held the camera still, between my knees.  Hey, worked great for me!! ).Anyway, I've noticed that a lot of buyers are complaining about the flash placement.  I agree, it is kind of odd to place a pop-up flash where we tend to hold these small cameras, but the camera was designed to be held with one hand.  So, once you're used to that idea, you will absolutely love this camera.  Now I said it was "designed" to be held with one hand, so take a good look at the camera right now, ( front and back ).  On the front, there is a bar running vertically, between the names NIKON and COOLPIX.  This is where one's right hand, middle finger, would rest.  It might not look like enough of a grip there, but trust me, it is.  On the back of the camera, there is a thumb pad, right beside the record button...the one with the bright red dot.  You'll find that holding the camera this way is quite comfortable. And of course, your index finger is free to do the shutter button work.  The anti-shake feature work incredibly well, so don't worry about the old one-hand-shake.  The rest of the functions will have to be adjusted with you other hand.  Don't worry, the camera works great in auto mode, if functions and settings scare you.  But frankly, this camera has so many great features, you'd be foolish to pass up on them.So, I don't see a design flaw here.  Use it the way it's intended, and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Semaj23
Reviews.Content: After a fair amount of reviewing different cameras, I was looking for something small I could carry instead of my large DSLR.  This camera was perfect.  With the quality of the pictures, great zoom, and light weight, this is the perfect camera when hiking, skiing, or when you just dont want to carry something big.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: This camara is the one I need:the quality of the pictures is excelent and it is very simple to handle

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: marimari
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for myself, and it's more than perfect!! This package include everything, and it's more than I expected. I'm really happy with this camera quality too! Many animals (squirrel etc)visit front of my bedroom, and I'm taking all those animals' picture & videos today. HAPPY!!!

Reviews.Title: Little Point & Shoot Camera Does the Job!!
Reviews.Author: sushiray00
Reviews.Content: Been using it for kids' sports activities (soccer, basketball, tennis), takes gr8 shots & video is good also with zoom! Happy with the quality of shots & audio on video. Taking close ups stills is fine except too close washes out subject with flash. Otherwise a gr8 buy for the price compared to other more expensive compact point & shoots. Kids friendly also!

Reviews.Title: Nice camer, sharp photos, good auto focus, good video
Reviews.Author: crocodile bobbies
Reviews.Content: Well, we finally got a digital camera that works well, in most situations. We find the problem with the pop up flash not really much of a problem, since your finger is still on the camera. It has excellent photos which even show the woof & warp of cloth, the finger print ridges, the color rendition is excellent. The video focus needs good light at times, but it can focus at 14x. The sound is good enough and the camera is somewhat easy to operate. One bonus is many movie file formats,which makes it easy to put video on our assus tablet!! The camera body is large enough to hold easily. We found the reviews on this camera only had one problem which was the flash. No problems with color accuracy, focusing, turn on time,. This camera does what we need it to do, and does it with ease.

Reviews.Title: needs instruction book
Reviews.Author: dvm
Reviews.Content: I like the camera so far. The size is small enough to fit in my purse and still large enough to have a nice size screen. I like the zoom as it pulls the image from a longer distance. It has a lot of features that I have not worked with yet. I wish it had a book with it so I sould carry it with me when I am learning about the new features. So that is a big down side for me.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 8200
Reviews.Author: Bill C. Youngquist
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great opticial zoom for its size. It takes pictures quick with hardly any shutter delay. The pictures also have great color and about 97% are in focus. The few cons would be the autoflash it comes up and catches your finger. It also goes down itself when shutting the camera off, if you push it down it will not stay down. The supplied battery charger plugs into camera making it usless when charging.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: carlin 20
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy having this camera, the ship and deliver was faster and the product was such as they describe!!

Reviews.Title: Lifespan 37 days
Reviews.Author: Kaddira
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews for the latest cameras I decided on the Nikon COOLPIX S8200. It seemed to have everything I wanted or needed without breaking my pocketbook. I'd only had it a short while so was still figuring out and playing with all the settings.Yesterday morning I woke up to the whooshing sound that indicated a hot air balloon was over my house. I grabbed the camera and took a couple of pictures. The images showed our lovely blue Colorado sky and beautifully rich colors of the balloon. Was excited to get some pictures of my daughter at her first Renaissance Festival later that morning, but it was not to be. When we got there I took photos of the jester and the fairies that were entertaining the crowd, my daughter took a picture of me with a huge Taurus, then we went to get our hair braided. Still hadn't noticed anything was wrong until we were waiting in line to get her face painted. I reviewed the pictures I had taken thus far, and there were these strange lines obscuring the images. The hot air balloon pictures from several hours earlier were fine. I experimented with the camera and noticed as it was trying to focus the bands would appear across the screen. The image would then look fine in the viewer, until I snapped the picture.I got the camera on June 16th, 2012. It broke 7 days over the return policy time - plus I no longer have the original packaging. My question into Nikon is still unanswered, but I realize has been less than 24 hours. Feelings right now are disappointment and anger. We leave for a 10 day trip to Alaska this Friday, which is not enough time for Nikon to fix the problem and get my camera back. 37 days for the COOLPIX S8200 to break. Looks like in the next couple of days I'll be out in the stores camera shopping, for anything but a Nikon.UPDATE: Nikon fixed the camera under warranty, but I still had to purchase a new one since we were going on an amazing trip. Decided on a bit more expensive Canon. Glad I did. Learned my lesson too. Once I called Nikon, things got rolling to get the camera fixed pretty quickly. The lady that I talked to was very friendly and helpful. If I would have just relied on the service website, I'd probably still be waiting.

Reviews.Title: I am happy with Nikon Coolpix S8200, hope it can comtinue improving with less price..
Reviews.Author: David Chang
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for its price range @ $190. Good quality, feeling, acceptable response time and operational functions (for this small size and battery lifetime), excellent quality of pic and color for the zoom lens. There is no need such as GPS, wireless transfer, etc. which will cause more problems, eat more battery and more expensive. Therefore, it is MUCH better than it successor, Nikon Coolpix S9500 at all.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob Morris
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because I'm a huge fan of Nikon. My previous camera was a Nikon COOLPIX S8000. I had my camera for a very long time & it eventually died.  I wanted the same exact camera so I picked out & bought the S8200.  It is a small upgrade from the the S8000. However when I got it, I was able to work it immediately. Super easy & fun to use. I get tons of compliments on all the pictures I take & I'm always the person to be taking the pictures cause my camera proves the best quality pictures. I will never veer from Nikon, their cameras are the best, I would reccomend to anyone/everyone!! :) Super Pleased!!

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love but...
Reviews.Author: jasonstuff "jasonstuff"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this. I'm a huge fan of Nikon and heard great things about it but this camera is awful. It takes FOREVER to take a picture. It is so so SLOW!!!  Especially with the flash, fully charged, it will take forever to take and often you have to click it twice.Also it has a popup flash, what??? it get's in the way and you have to manually close it to put it back in the case.  It does look nice and feel great. It has some awesome options but they need to make it faster and easy to turn on and click even if it means losing features. Right now if you want to grab a quick shot, use your phone, not this camera. By the time you get it power up, focus and actually take the shot, the moment will have long passed.Very disappointed and with so many cameras, so many options, I'm beginning to wonder how you find that perfect camera at a great price point that just does what a camera should do, take great pictures fast and efficiently.Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: Good choice - easy to use!
Reviews.Author: PelRev2012
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera! --- Here is why,1. Point and shoot/auto option takes great photos.2. Really impressed with the zoom, considering it is all one piece.3. Lots of options for the casual camera user.4. It's so SMALL.5. Great screen clarity!6. Excellent color quality. I have had issues in the past with yellow-ish looking pics.The "downs" of this camera... if I have to be picky.1. The battery door seems flimsy.  I am worried I might snap it off.2. The flash is VERY annoying.  If it comes on, there is no way to retract it. You have to turn the camera off.  Even the position of the flash is annoying, because my hand needs to go there!3. I wish it used AA batteries, instead of a rechargeable one.4. Did I mention the flash was annoying?5. Wish there were a battery charger, rather than having to plug the camera into the wall.That being said -- I really like the "ups" and for $250 - I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Originally gave 5 stars - down graded to 3
Reviews.Author: Chimpy
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon, not just for the buying power but because of the reviews. Anytime I am going to buy something, I always go to Amazon and see what people here are saying about the product. I did not buy this camera at Amazon but I did buy it because of the reviews I read here. I've been researching my next camera for about 7-8 months now and I was ready to buy the Nikon 8100 and saw there was a newer version, this one. I read all the reviews so I knew about the flash sticking out (so no surprise there). I have another Nikon I've had for about 5 years and kind of wanted to stay with the same brand (although I was ready to get a different one if I couldn't find the right Nikon). I got this one on sale and have had it for a few days and have been very pleased.  The night time photos are great. I've done some panaramic shots that I love. I did a bunch of shots of my softball team last night. Took some video too. Lots of pet shots so far. Everything has been great.I recommend reading the manual when buying a camera like this. I read it and am referring back to it a lot. I also know a lot about the camera already from already having a Nikon, so that helps.  After a few weeks I will come back and update this - so far I'm loving this camera quite a bit.Update: I've had the camera for a couple months - I love it. No problems whatsoever. The video is excellent, in fact I've taken way more video than stills, not something I planned and it's been great. I have no gripes whatsoever with this camera. It's done everything I wanted it to do. A great buy.Update: Had problem with lens. Was producing spots under certain kinds of lights. Showed a camera expert friend and he told me the only way to get it fixed was to send it to Nikon. Called their "support" which was a long wait (big surprise) and eventually getting someone who basically told me to go online - all which I could have done on my own without wasting a half hour on the phone. Why they have a number to call when all they do is have you do everything online is a mystery - but I took one star off my review for that. Sent the camera in (on my own dime of course, they don't even pay for postage). Problem was under warranty so they did fix it - took about 8 weeks without the camera which of course was during Thanksgiving (so I had to use an older camera during the Holiday). Couldn't get ANYONE to return any email either as to what was going on with my camera even though I sent it registered mail so I did have a receipt saying they got it. Took four weeks for someone to just get back to me to let me know they did have it. I took off another star for that. Camera was fixed and sent back. Appears the problem has been fixed but I can't totally tell until I use it under the same lighting (which I will do this week). The support was awful. This will be the last Nikon I ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Nice features
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: Well featured camera with great picture quality abd flexible formatting. Flash location was poorly planned. Does a great job on action photos. Good choice for the price point.

Reviews.Title: please don't buy it
Reviews.Author: w ted
Reviews.Content: I owned this camera for more than a year. It has good qualities like good pictures and even few videos. but it has a serious flow the on /off button stuk and you are done after that. I recomended to a freind got in to the same problem and had to return it.

Reviews.Title: horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Southern Gal "Jan"
Reviews.Content: So disappointed.  I bought this to replace a 3 yr old Samsung digital camera which had been stolen.  My daughter in law was close to her due date, so I needed a quick replacement.  Given the product reviews, price point and functionality, I thought this would be the perfect replacement.  Boy was I wrong!  Pictures all had a greenish reddish cast, grainy in appearance if they even came out at all.  I re-read the manual and tried all different settings but picture quality was still poor. Missed getting any photos to celebrate birth of new baby.

Reviews.Title: Good Luck if you need Warranty Service - NADA
Reviews.Author: A. Ioannides "Ari"
Reviews.Content: This camera came new in the box damaged. It looked OK and took nice photos, but the USB port would not work. The seller would not accept a return because the box got discarded with the other Christmas boxes and Nikon refused to repair it under warranty. Despite numerous requests Nikon said the defect was my fault. Can you believe? I have well over $10,000 of Nikon DSLR equipment and they wanted to charge me over $100 to fix a new $279 camera. I love my Nikon stuff and never had to deal with the customer service before, but if you need warranty repair, forget it! Nikon is not a company that is customer focused. The rep on the phone actually told me that, can you believe? Yea, he said the repair person would be upset with him if he asked for a reevaluation of the warranty status. WOW!I'm switching all of my gear to Cannon!

Reviews.Title: bad experience....
Reviews.Author: A customer
Reviews.Content: first time I ever bought from 'market place'...was not a good experience...Amex had to step in for me to get my credit!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: bugsrf "bugsrf"
Reviews.Content: So Far works great!! Got hear in amazing time. Pictures are great when taking them. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Why does the flash open in the worst spot?!?!?!?!
Reviews.Author: Zachary Allen
Reviews.Content: I'm embarrassed to ask people/friends to take pictures of me bc I will automatically have to ask them twice since the damn flash pops up in the wort spot EVER!!! Someone should be fired for that!!! Good pictures and easy to use but the damn flash is so annoying...makes it hard to hold.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good...
Reviews.Author: Belinda Fultz "BeeGirl"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to be my "always in my purse camera" to avoid lugging our Nikon D3100 or Cannon Rebel around all the time.  While this camera is good, it is far from coming close to a D3100 or Cannon Rebel. If you are not use to the flexibility and options with a larger digital camera then you will probably love this camera and have no issue with it.  I do keep it in my purse most of the time and I do use it regularly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: William Kaftan
Reviews.Content: This thing works just great so I gave away my eight megapixel Canon to my daughter that cost me $1000.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera
Reviews.Author: mamoun
Reviews.Content: this camera amazing for that pricethe pics looks real even in nightvery good material and looks greati recommend to buy it

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: 504 Westbank Boy
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S8200 was a gift for my wife so far so good she loves it. Great purchase for a beginning photographer.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste you money
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: There were was problems early & often. My biggest complaint is the LCD went blank so the camera is not usable. I tried to return the camera & was told it was too late to return. Don't buy this camera. You've been warned. Nikon should be ashamed the put their name on this piece of crap!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Robin McLaren
Reviews.Content: My wife just looked at me when she openned this gift for Christmas. "I already have a camera she stated" After taking multiple pictures of our family during the day, she said "now I really have a camera"It takes wonderful pictures with great definition including close-ups. She got used to the flash popping up (a minor annoyance until she learned to keep the finger away from the popup window) but truly it is agreat camera

Reviews.Title: Amazon poor service and wrong parts
Reviews.Author: Nancy Yturriaga Adams
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera, unfortunately Amazon did not include the correct USB cable in the shipment.  When I called them to ask about it they were very snotty---telling me I have to go thru Nikon, here's a link to their web address.  So, I go to Nikon.  I fill out tons of information about myself, product, etc.  Then the website erases it all as I tried to submit it.  Finally I get on the phone and get to customer service.  They agree to send the correct USB cable, but unfortunately they are out of stock so I will just have to wait.Three weeks go by, and I still cannot use my camera,  finally, the cable comes in the mail and I was able to charge the camera.  I do all as said in the manual, but to my surprise, when it comes to photographing art work, the colors do not photograph true.  I try to figure out what the problem is, but have no clue.  I touch up my images with Picassa and they are good enough for documentation, but not good enough to sell on line.After 6 months, the camera refuses to charge----so I call Nikon.  Again, the big runaround and again, the erasing by the website of submitted inquiries.  Finally, resorting to the phone, the tech has me take the camera apart and I find that Amazon has sent me an incompatible SD card.  There is no info on Amazon as to which is the correct one, so I bought what they recommended.  The Nikon tech then informs me that the card I bought has destroyed my nearly new camera!At this point I have had it.  I researched carefully before buying, bought the extended warranty and at this time, I am without my camera, as it might be serviced or replaced or who knows what by Nikon.  Amazon?  They are done, they got their money and I am left without a camera.Now this is not fair to the camera---it seems a good one, but do not make the mistake of using non-Nikon approved SD cards, or chancing that someone will send you an incompatible USB card.  that's all on Amazon, and they were no help at all when this mess came down.

Reviews.Title: Too many items needed to charge the battery.
Reviews.Author: Joe Chicago "A Regular Guy"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this camera and from the reviews, I really think I would have except for one item I discovered after I opened the box. To charge the battery, it requires four (4) items. Their charger which connects to their proprietary cable which is needed to connect to the camera which then charges the battery. My other cameras only require the charger and the battery snaps into the charger. The cable is a non-standard cable. If it was a standard cable...I'd feel a little better about knowing I could find one anywhere if I broke (or more likely) lost it while on a trip. Having to charge the battery via the camera...on a trip I find the outlets which are easy to get to get taken over by my and the wife's cell phones and maybe the laptop. That leaves the outlets near the floor or the one in the bathroom for the hair dryer. A battery which snaps into a charger is fine for either of those but putting my camera on the floor or right next to the sink just makes it seem like I'm asking for Mr. Murphy to stop by.

Reviews.Title: Whole bunch of specs zero substance
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I've had Canon, Sony and Fuji Cameras and the Nikon 8200 is the worst camera I ever bought. The camera feels flimsy the and buttons are in my opinion too close together. Tried to take several videos and they where blurry at best the camera has a real issue with focusing in video mode. i tried for days to tweak its settings but still wasn't happy with it. Indoor picture taking is ok but for some reason the subjects in the pictures are blurry. Outdoor pictures seem out of focus too and color was lacking. Panorama feature is sub par my smartphone does a better job.The zoom on the camera is quirky and shaky especial during video mode (feels like your on a roller coaster).The only pro that i give this camera is the LCD screen is very sharp.RecommendationsSony DSC-HX9VFuji FinePix F600EXR

Reviews.Title: arrived damage and could not get a credit
Reviews.Author: russ
Reviews.Content: This camera arrived in none working order. I return for repair three times and on the last time was informed that it was damaged, of course I new that as I have had it going off and on from date of frist use.  I find it hard to believe that this company know wants me to repair for fixing it when it arrived in that condition.  I would not recommend buying as they have had a couple of times and can only change the reason it does not work and of course they have tried to repair twice with no at the Nikon repair center able to do.  I do not think this is a company you would want to get anything from.

Reviews.Title: WOULD give it 1/s star more but don't know how to do it.
Reviews.Author: A. Tay "Private Tay"
Reviews.Content: EVEN though it HAS NO:a.  Programmed, Aperture, Shutter or Manual modesb.  Spot-meteringYou can control ISO and there's exposure compensation, which, technically is what the pros of old used since their cameras had no spot-meteringbought this because it was selling for about U$50 - brand new14x zoom's not bad for this price25mm - 350mm lensI read that the 8200 replaces the 9100, which had 18x zoomLike most replacement models, the makers just pumped up the mega pixels and maybe added touchscreen (not on the 8200)'Lesson'here:a. don't always get the latest model - sometimes, it is not as good (because the makers remove costlier features - on video cameras, this could be external mic jack, A/V in/out)b. an earlier model may have better featuresc. an earlier model may cost a fraction of the latestd. before going to a shop to buy a camera, ALWAYS find out what the next and previous models were/will beBack to the 8200Get it - if you can for U$50Sure, there are better 14x zoom cameras but few at U$50.7 Mar 13BATTERY life for this camera seems a bit short - or maybe its an old battery, not sure. I've been swapping it with the p310 (same battery)P310 SEEMS to last longer, then again, with the p310, it's almost always at 24mm - so I get f1.8

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix sucks
Reviews.Author: Dhav
Reviews.Content: The camera has this weird pop-up for flash that doesn't click back in. The digital zoom isn't stable and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: sucker
Reviews.Content: This camera sucks. The shutter is very fragile. 14x zoom os only apealing if it works. Lasted not even 3 months. Would not return. Nikon customer service hung up on me 3 times, refused to allow me to speak with a manager, or even provide their own mames. do not buy this piece of crap. not a well designed product.

Reviews.Title: First and Last
Reviews.Author: db in tn
Reviews.Content: This is my first and last Nikon purchase.  Lasted less than a year and a half and when it quit it cost as much too fix it as a new one cost.  The lens began to open and then close without even being able to take a picture.  I will not buy another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon needs better instructions
Reviews.Author: ritasel
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix 8200 6 months ago. I was pleased with the camera until it started to have problems. After shooting a few pictures on a hot, humid day, it went black when holding the camera vertically. Therefore you cannot see what you are shooting. It worked fine horizontally. I called Nikon when I returned from my vacation and they said to send it back since it was under warranty. I did (at my own expense). It was returned in record time since I told them I was going away again. And, taking pictures at the same lake on a hot day, the camera went black again when holding it vertically. I got no satisfaction when I called Nikon, even after I spoke to a supervisor. I was told to send it back, again. They would send me a return label. But, I need the camera for an event in 2 weeks. I was told it could not be returned by then.  It should have been fixed the first time. I now have to buy another camera. I can assure you it will NOT be a Nikon.If you read below to see comments to my review, you will see the suggestion that he LCD screen may be polarized and that wearing polarized sunglasses will make the LCD screen appear black. I called Nikon to ask if that could be the case, I was told that it was NOT polarized. There was also no mention of polarization in the large instruction manual that I downloaded. But the LCD is indeed polarized. When my camera was returned to me from Nikon, I put my sunglasses on, turned the camera vertically and the screen turned black. I took off the sunglasses and had a perfectly viewable screen.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: aileen
Reviews.Content: camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. There are just a few things I do not like about it. The main dislike is the very small, tiny on/off button. Way to small. The flash is small and if you don;t pay attention your finger holds it down. The camera itself is great as an x-tra camera to carry in your purse or take as as an extra camera. Overall the camera is easy to use and takes great pictures, But I would not have it as my main camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon comes up short
Reviews.Author: UpNortGuy
Reviews.Content: This camera was barely used for the first five weeks I had it when it died. I contacted support before sending it back in and they recommended buying a new battery. The battery was replaced and the camera started working again. The camera has not been used long enough to comment on anything else. I just think it is pretty pathetic that a company like Nikon is dumping bad batteries on their customers.

Reviews.Title: Is nothing but is advertised
Reviews.Author: Bianca
Reviews.Content: The shipment was fast and well paqaged. The camera is as advertised, a point and shoot, nikon quality for your pocket. Dont expect DSLR quality. Clear pictures and nice video in HD. The position of the flash is the only annoying thing, just shouldnt be there, but you can take pictures anyways.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: lovelabs "lovelabs"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Small enough to carry in your purse.  Takes great pictures. Still learning all the functions but so far so good.  My sister loved this camera so much she also purchased one.  Great price on Amazon too!

Reviews.Title: AVOID
Reviews.Author: Laurie Moe
Reviews.Content: Please avoid buying the Nikon S8200.  I purchased this camera cause the reviews I read were good for the most part.  I purchased it new and received a used one.  I tried to use it but it just didn't seem to be working right.  It was taking forever once you turned it on to be able to take a picture.  And it just wouldn't focus on a moving object...So I returned it the next day...Amazon was amazing sending me a new one and I received it the next day.  The new one also was taking to long once you turned it on.  Guess that is how it works.  But once again the focus was still taking blurry pictures.  So I put it away for about a week...Well my husband wanted to take some pictures outside.  Well the flash was on...which is a whole different issue with this camera.  Took the picture and no picture it was all black.  So back this camera went.  The other huge reason to avoid this camera is the flash pops up right where your finger goes.  Not to mention Nikons actual customer service is the worst ever.  They told me I would hear back in 24 hours.  Well it has been one week and they still have not responded.

Reviews.Title: How to give Negative Stars--Wish I Could
Reviews.Author: B. Meaker "peppermint patty"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas. It has a "fly up flash" feature. There is no warning sticker about this "classy" feature, and its flying action caused me to drop it less than 24 hours later. I don't know what Amazon will do for you, but Nikon will do zip, zilch, nada. You be screwed. Buyer be oh so wary of this camera. I did not order it from Amazon.com, but I paid $209.88 for it. The camera SUCKS.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S8200 16.1 MP
Reviews.Author: MSH
Reviews.Content: i get this camera after 2 week of online searching and comparing with same pries camera .1st thing .. its disappointing me cuz i think it will take pictures like a professional DSLR but its NOT true .otherwise its really take great pic and have great lens but not great image quality !!any way its a great camera.

Reviews.Title: bought 2 S8200 with dust inside its lens, avoid this model!!
Reviews.Author: H&S; "Tallica's"
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX S8200 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 14x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)After reading its specs and checking its price, I bought Coolpix S8200, zoomed in and started shooting light clear surfaces like walls and white areas, found 2 blurry dark spots on the photos always at the same place, max zoom out and its gone, zoom-in little bit again and 2 spots are there, Dust in the lens compartment, the seller replaced it with another new one, and guess what? its only one spot in the middle, when you max zoom out its gone, it seems that this model is being assembled in dirty places in China!!!!!I quit, Im not replacing it, Ill give it to my brother to play with it, I have all the evidences from the old one and the new one!!!!After trying another compact camera while this one being replaced, another famous brand So** and after trying its high compression and processing affecting my photos and videos I can say thank god that I lost it!! going back to my trusted brand!!! you guessed it.. Ca***, bought 6 compact cameras from them so far and its all blazing good!!!Nikon = China  Ca*** = JapanDo the math!!!

Reviews.Title: One of the best point and shoots
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: The quality of this HD video is amazing for a point and shoot, definitely on par with canon brands. The still shots are bad, altough low light settings still arent that great

Reviews.Title: super saver shipping,
Reviews.Author: chief crazyhorse "Rich"
Reviews.Content: I really read alot of great reviews on this camera,but I don't have my camera yet to really write any about the camera nikon s8200,I ordered my nikon s8200 on Feb.14,2012 on sat.But here it's Thursday evening Feb.19,2012 5 days after I ordered it.BUT THEY SAY THAT IT WILL BE SHIPPED FOR ARRIVAL BETWEEN Feb.20 to Feb.25.Now what I don't understand is why can't it  be ship after I ordered it that day,why make the customer wait,I've order before and items have been shipped the next day with super saver shipping.This makes great customer relation,like there really busy,with our slow economy.Just blewing some steam at AMAZON get it AMAZON!I know this review doesn't belong here.  RichardNikon COOLPIX S8200 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 14x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)

ProductInfo.Features:
16.1 effective megapixel 1/2.3" CMOS sensor for fast capture and superior low light shooting
14x optical Zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens, 25-350mm (35mm equivalent) captures action that's both near and far
3-inch ultra-high resolution (921,000-dot) LCD monitor with Clear Color display and anti-reflection coating
Full HD (1080p) movie recording with stereo sound and one touch record button, great movies made easy
Easy Panorama, Night and Backlight/HDR modes, shoot in new creative ways
